segment.source: About Virtual Environments
segment.target: About Virtual Environments

segment.source: About Virtual Environments
segment.target: About Virtual Environments

segment.source: About Virtual Environments
segment.target: About Virtual Environments

segment.source: Virtual applications run in virtual environments.
segment.target: Virtual applications run in virtual environments.

segment.source: Virtual environments enable each application to run on a desktop, laptop, or Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server without installation and alteration of the host operating system.
segment.target: Virtual environments enable each application to run on a desktop, laptop, or Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server without installation and alteration of the host operating system.

segment.source: Each application carries its own configuration information in the virtual environment.
segment.target: Each application carries its own configuration information in the virtual environment.

segment.source: As a result, many applications run side by side with other applications on the same computer without any conflicts.
segment.target: As a result, many applications run side by side with other applications on the same computer without any conflicts.

segment.source: Virtual applications run locally, so they run with the full performance, functionality, and access to local services that you would expect from any application installed locally.
segment.target: Virtual applications run locally, so they run with the full performance, functionality, and access to local services that you would expect from any application installed locally.

segment.source: Because each application runs in a virtual environment, the following problems are reduced:
segment.target: Because each application runs in a virtual environment, the following problems are reduced:

segment.source: Application conflicts—In environments that do not use Application Virtualization, you must thoroughly test every application to ensure that it does not interfere with other installed applications.
segment.target: Application conflicts—In environments that do not use Application Virtualization, you must thoroughly test every application to ensure that it does not interfere with other installed applications.

segment.source: Regression testing—Because the application does not change the underlying operating system, lengthy regression testing is eliminated.
segment.target: Regression testing—Because the application does not change the underlying operating system, lengthy regression testing is eliminated.

segment.source: Version incompatibilities—Different versions of the same application can run simultaneously on the same computer.
segment.target: Version incompatibilities—Different versions of the same application can run simultaneously on the same computer.

segment.source: Multiuser access—Applications that do not run in multiuser mode, and therefore cannot run within an RD Session Host, can now do so and function correctly for multiple users on a single RD Session Host.
segment.target: Multiuser access—Applications that do not run in multiuser mode, and therefore cannot run within an RD Session Host, can now do so and function correctly for multiple users on a single RD Session Host.

segment.source: Multitenancy issues—Two instances of the same application that use different configurations can run on the same computer at the same time.
segment.target: Multitenancy issues—Two instances of the same application that use different configurations can run on the same computer at the same time.

segment.source: Server siloing—The need for many separate server farms is eliminated.
segment.target: Server siloing—The need for many separate server farms is eliminated.

segment.source: Virtual environments include a virtual registry for each application.
segment.target: Virtual environments include a virtual registry for each application.

segment.source: Registry settings created by one application cannot be seen by other applications or utilities such as Regedit.
segment.target: Registry settings created by one application cannot be seen by other applications or utilities such as Regedit.

segment.source: Rather than copying the entire registry, the virtual registry uses an overlay method.
segment.target: Rather than copying the entire registry, the virtual registry uses an overlay method.

segment.source: Items in the client registry can be read by the application as long as a virtual copy of that registry item is not included in the virtual registry.
segment.target: Items in the client registry can be read by the application as long as a virtual copy of that registry item is not included in the virtual registry.

segment.source: All application writes to the registry are contained in the virtual registry.
segment.target: All application writes to the registry are contained in the virtual registry.

segment.source: Virtual environments also include a virtual file system and other virtual components, including virtual services and virtual COM.
segment.target: Virtual environments also include a virtual file system and other virtual components, including virtual services and virtual COM.

segment.target: Related topics
